report_title: Industry Research: Cementing Oil & Gas Well Services
executive_summary: The Cementing Oil and Gas Well Services industry comprises companies engaged in providing cementing, well sealing and mixing services to oil and gas well operators. Cementing operations are performed so that oil and gas wells are secured in place and surrounding environments are not contaminated by the extraction process. The use of cementing also improves wellbore integrity by preventing caverns from forming and other parts of the borehole from collapsing. Cementing services are also widely used to plug wells that are at the end their life cycle.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Price shocks from volatile oil and gas prices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: World energy prices have been extremely volatile over the past five years, with the world price of crude oil ultimately growing at an annualized rate of 4.0% to $64.3 per barrel in 2022. This volatility led to anemic investment in new wells and rigs at times, causing demand for cementing services to slow. However, as energy demand improved upon the retracement of global lockdowns, drilling activity increased and benefited demand for well cementing services.

The industry benefited from rapidly growing proved oil and natural gas reserves over the past decade, as fracking enabled access to previously unobtainable deposits. Proved natural gas reserves grew dramatically due to ability to extract shale gas. The wider fracking implementation provided more opportunity for cementing services at new fracking sites.

Companies in the industry increased their sizes through consolidation over the past five years, which is typical for the oil and gas sector. As a result, industry employment declined at an annualized 2.3% as larger companies acquired smaller ones.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Crude oil and natural gas prices are projected to rebound from recent lows over the next five years, resulting in greater investment from oil and gas companies that will increase demand for cementing services. However, prices are expected to remain volatile due to potential supply shocks and demand fluctuations.

Productivity gains from technologies like horizontal drilling and multi-stage fracking are expected to boost demand initially. But productivity is anticipated to abate as the highest-productivity areas are depleted and fewer major breakthroughs occur.

Regulatory requirements, particularly around fracking, are expected to become more stringent which could limit new drilling opportunities. The industry will also face more competition from renewable energy sources as oil and gas prices rise.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in supplying cementing, pumping and mixing services to oil and gas wells. Operators also provide cement plugging for oil and gas wells and other cement maintenance. Industry establishments are not involved in exploration activities or the drilling of oil and gas wells.

positive_impact_factors: High and steady barriers to entry
negative_impact_factors: Low and steady level of assistance

opportunities: Demand from oil drilling and gas extraction

key_trends: The industry has benefited from rapidly growing proved oil and natural gas reserves
Exploration activity is likely to be constrained as energy producers seek to cut costs
Companies in the industry have increased their sizes through consolidation
The world price of natural gas will rise due to energy demand from emerging economies
Productivity gains are expected to abate toward the end of the outlook period
Regulatory requirements are expected to become increasingly stringent
The industry has been highly volatile due to massive fluctuations in crude oil and natural gas prices

market_segmentation.segment_description: Oil extractors require cementing services for exploratory drilling operations. Over the five years to 2022, this segment increased as a share of industry revenue as oil-drilling activity has accelerated.
Gas extractors' share of industry revenue has declined slightly over the five years to 2022, largely due to more favorable oil prices which have emerged over the five years to 2022.
This segment includes miscellaneous well-plugging services and, most notably, the sealing of abandoned oil and gas wells throughout the United States.

products_and_services.product_description: The cementing process occurs at the casing point when drilling operations cease and well owners decide to move forward with well completion.
Gas well cementing services are expected to account for 14.0% of revenue for the year.
Industry operators provide well-plugging services which are used to fill depleted or nonproductive wells with cement plugs.
Additionally, dry wells, which are boreholes that do not yield productive resources but still may have oil and gas present, must be sealed to protect groundwater sources from leakage.
Other services provided by the industry are expected to account for 9.9% of industry revenue in 2022. These services include miscellaneous borehole plugging and squeeze cementing.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The price of oil and gas largely determines whether companies actively seek to develop new wells.
Production levels of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) members and other oil and gas producers affect demand.
Regional supply and demand for natural gas is a demand determinant.
Worldwide expenditure on offshore drilling affects industry demand.
Overall global economic activity is a demand determinant for the industry.
Regulation for oil and gas drillers impacts demand for cementing services.
The development and use of alternative fuel sources affects demand.

international_trade_points.trade_description: While companies in the industry typically manufacture cement mixtures that are traded internationally, the service nature of this industry indicates that there is no international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The majority of industry operators are concentrated in the Southwest region of the United States. In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that 53.4% of industry establishments are located in this region, and that the most concentrated state, Texas, holds 36.7% of total establishments.

The Southeast region is estimated to house 14.7% of industry establishments in 2022. Similar to the Southwest, this region's prominence in the industry is due to the high number of active oil and gas wells in the area.
Of the other regions in the United States, the Rocky Mountains region is also estimated to hold a significant concentration of establishments in 2022, with 12.4%.
Of the other regions in the United States, the Plains region is also estimated to hold a significant concentration of establishments in 2022, with 7.7%.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Safe Drinking Water Act, enforced by the Environmental Protection Agency, sets requirements for proper well construction to minimize risks of contamination to underground water sources.
Regulations applicable to offshore drilling can have an indirect effect on the industry, such as the moratorium on new offshore oil drilling leases after the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.
Federal, state and local regulations imposed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have impacted economic activity and oil and gas extraction activities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Long-standing relationships between hydrocarbon producers and oil field servicing companies is a major barrier.
Immense technical knowledge required to operate successfully and liabilities in case of well failure are barriers.
Each borehole requires individual attention to type and amount of cement needed, requiring expertise.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators must compete to obtain favorable contracts with oil and gas producers, awarded on competitive bid basis. Price, quality, experienced labor are key factors.
Domestic operators face international competition for contracts with major oil and gas companies. Larger companies have more experience and technical knowledge.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest companies account for an estimated 33.9% of industry revenue in 2022.
The largest upstream oil and gas producers typically contract companies for the most advanced services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are expected to account for 25.3% of industry revenue in 2022 and have declined slightly over the past five years. Companies in the industry have full-time employees and also subcontract much of their work as new contracts become available. This enables operators to be more flexible in payments when there is no continuous flow of work.

Purchases are estimated to account for 21.7% of industry revenue in 2022. Purchases represents one of the largest expenses for industry players. Companies in the industry are required to purchase cement, sand and other chemicals that are then pumped from the slurry to around the casing.

Over the past five years, cementing oil and gas well services implemented new technologies increasing capabilities and efficiency. As a result, industry depreciation has risen to account for 6.9% of revenue in 2022.

Other industry costs are estimated to account for 33.1% of industry revenue. The industry attracts other miscellaneous expenses including legal fees, insurance costs, surveying fees, regulatory consulting fees and travel expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: IBISWorld estimates that for every dollar spent on wages, an industry operator will spend $0.27 on capital investment. Industry operators require advanced pressure pumping systems and equipment to properly mix and pour cement into wellbore casings.
Operators must also transport cement to and from drill sites, which requires capital investment in vehicles and transportation equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for industry services is generally tied to that of the Oil Drilling and Gas Extraction industry, so incumbent operators are exposed to fluctuations in the world prices of crude oil and natural gas and resultant changes in overall drilling activity.
The COVID-19 pandemic resulted in widespread economic lockdowns which limited oil consumption and caused a sharp contraction in energy demand, resulting in fewer industry services being performed.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Surges in hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling techniques have enabled oil and gas producers to tap into previously uneconomical shale deposits. Cement servicers rely on advanced pressure pump technologies and geological analysis of wellbores.

The increasing attention that government agencies, particularly the Environmental Protection Agency, pay to the environmental impact of hydraulic fracturing may drive further technological change in the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize heavily or do you extract a diversified range of resources?
FAQs.answer: Large operators specialize in a range of services and therefore tend to dominate.

FAQs.question: Does your company rely heavily on demand from a single, key market?
FAQs.answer: Companies primarily rely on production activities within the oil and gas sector in the country.

FAQs.question: Has your company dealt with volatile prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatile prices of crude oil and natural gas have made for a difficult operating environment, especially for smaller operators during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: Does your company perform research and development to keep up with the latest extraction techniques?
FAQs.answer: Companies both large and small spend a considerable amount of money on research and development costs to develop new technologies.

FAQs.question: How is your company using new technology, such as new drilling techniques?
FAQs.answer: Technological innovation is a strong competitive advantage for operators in the industry.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wages continue to constitute a proportion of total revenue on account of expertise required to conduct industry operations.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted your company's profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulatory expenses have remained stable in the industry over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How have recent changes to environmental standards impacted your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies continue to spend a large amount of capital on compliance costs such as environmental regulations.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margin has improved somewhat over the past five years on account of margin increases in the overall level of demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Prices of inputs have relatively remained stable over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain product quality? Do you have a reputation for providing high-quality services?
FAQs.answer: Companies in the industry must supply high-quality products, due to the environmental concerns of oil and gas leakage into drinkable water sources. Cement must meet regulatory standards to ensure well integrity.

FAQs.question: How do you keep on top of shifting regulations? What measures have you undergone to remain in compliance with new laws?
FAQs.answer: Operators in the industry must abide by strict environmental regulations because much of oil and gas is discovered around drinkable water sources.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company to suppliers?
Have you been able to secure any contracts with suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry benefit from having strong relationships with suppliers of concrete and aggregate products.

FAQs.question: How have lower natural gas prices affected demand for your services? What do you do when demand is low?
FAQs.answer: The world price of natural gas drives demand for gas extraction activity, which leads to an increased need for cementing services. As the world price of natural gas increases, businesses require more support services, such as cementing, to facilitate greater activity.

FAQs.question: What impact has regulation historically had on your business? How could regulations concerning fracking affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Mining companies are subject to a high risk of environmental liability and many companies account for environmental remediation liabilities associated with operations.

FAQs.question: Does your revenue move in line with crude oil prices? How was your company affected by plummeting prices?
FAQs.answer: An increase in the price of crude oil typically leads to increased demand for oil drilling and extraction. Increased activity by oil drilling and extraction.
